response_parsed.title: Securing Batch Jobs Using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to use FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs, to secure batch jobs in Python 3.12+. It covers authentication, authorization, and handling errors.
key_points: Using FastAPI for securing batch jobs provides a scalable and flexible solution.
This example utilizes JWT (JSON Web Tokens) for authentication and authorization.
It demonstrates how to handle errors effectively when executing long-running tasks.
FastAPI allows for easy integration with popular third-party libraries such as uvicorn, starlette, and more.
version_notes: This example is written for Python 3.12+ and uses the latest FastAPI version (0.76.0 as of March 2023).
It also assumes the use of a secret key for authentication.
caveats: Remember to replace 'your-secret-key' with a secure secret key for your application.
This example provides a basic setup and further customizations may be required based on specific requirements.
Always ensure you are handling sensitive data securely.
